page.title: 03PIGGERIES,POULTRY,FARM SHOPS
page.content: Harleston Hall has 400 pigs and 6000 chickens.The pigs are sent to a national supermarket chain where they are slaughtered and used for bacon and sausages.Home Farm owns 180 sows which live on a farm of 25 acres.The boars on the farm,are sold for bacon or used for breeding purposes.The final piggery is to be found on the edge of Combs.It covers 11 acres of land and it is occupied by 1000 pigs and 25000 chickens.The pigs are slaughtered after 5 months and are sent to Norfolk.The chickens are slaughtered after 10 weeks and sold to another national supermarket chain. In our area there is a farm shop which sells fruit,vegetables (many of which they grow),gifts and eggs.
